content:
DiscoveryClient Class

In this Article

Allows you to discover available services.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class DiscoveryClient : IDisposable, System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • DiscoveryClient

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Constructors summary

DiscoveryClient()

Creates a new instance of the DiscoveryClient class.
DiscoveryClient(DiscoveryEndpoint)

Creates a new instance of the DiscoveryClient class with the specified discovery endpoint.
DiscoveryClient(String)

Creates a new instance of the DiscoveryClient class with the specified endpoint configuration.

Properties summary

ChannelFactory

Gets the channel factory for the DiscoveryClient.
ClientCredentials

Gets the client credentials for the DiscoveryClient.
Endpoint

Gets the endpoint used to send discovery messages.
InnerChannel

Gets the channel used to send discovery messages.

Methods summary

CancelAsync(Object)

Cancels a pending asynchronous operation.
Close()

Closes the discovery client.
Find(FindCriteria)

Sends a request to find services that match the specified criteria.
FindAsync(FindCriteria)

Begins an asynchronous find operation with the specified criteria.
FindAsync(FindCriteria,Object)

Begins an asynchronous find operation with the specified criteria and user defined state object.
FindTaskAsync(FindCriteria)

Begins an asynchronous find task operation with the specified criteria.
FindTaskAsync(FindCriteria,CancellationToken)

Begins an asynchronous find task operation with the specified criteria and cancellation token object.
Open()

Opens the DiscoveryClient.
Resolve(ResolveCriteria)

Begins an asynchronous resolve operation with the specified criteria.
ResolveAsync(ResolveCriteria)

Begins an asynchronous resolve operation with the specified criteria.
ResolveAsync(ResolveCriteria,Object)

Begins an asynchronous resolve operation with the specified criteria and user-defined state object.
ResolveTaskAsync(ResolveCriteria)

Begins an asynchronous resolve task operation with the specified criteria.
ResolveTaskAsync(ResolveCriteria,CancellationToken)

Begins an asynchronous resolve task operation with the specified criteria and cancellation token.

Events summary

FindCompleted

Occurs when the entire find operation completes.
FindProgressChanged

Occurs every time the client receives a response from a particular service.
ProxyAvailable

Occurs when a multicast suppression message is received from a discovery proxy in response to the find or resolve operation.
ResolveCompleted

Occurs when an asynchronous resolve operation is completed.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IDisposable.Dispose()

Provides an implementation of the stem.IDisposable.Dispose* method.
ICommunicationObject.Abort()

Causes a communication object to transition immediately from its current state into the closed state.
ICommunicationObject.BeginClose(AsyncCallback,Object)

Begins an asynchronous operation to close a communication object.
ICommunicationObject.BeginClose(TimeSpan,AsyncCallback,Object)

Begins an asynchronous operation to close a communication object with a specified timeout.
ICommunicationObject.BeginOpen(AsyncCallback,Object)

Begins an asynchronous operation to open a communication object.
ICommunicationObject.BeginOpen(TimeSpan,AsyncCallback,Object)

Begins an asynchronous operation to open a communication object within a specified interval of time.
ICommunicationObject.Close()

Causes a communication object to transition from its current state into the closed state.
ICommunicationObject.Close(TimeSpan)

Causes a communication object to transition from its current state into the closed state within a specified interval of time.
ICommunicationObject.EndClose(IAsyncResult)

Completes an asynchronous operation to close a communication object.
ICommunicationObject.EndOpen(IAsyncResult)

Completes an asynchronous operation to open a communication object.
ICommunicationObject.Open()

Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state.
ICommunicationObject.Open(TimeSpan)

Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state within a specified interval of time.
ICommunicationObject.State

Gets the current state of the communication-oriented object.

Constructors

  • DiscoveryClient()

    Creates a new instance of the DiscoveryClient class.

    public DiscoveryClient ();
  • DiscoveryClient(DiscoveryEndpoint)

    Creates a new instance of the DiscoveryClient class with the specified discovery endpoint.

    public DiscoveryClient (System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint discoveryEndpoint);

    Parameters

    • discoveryEndpoint
      DiscoveryEndpoint

      The discovery endpoint to use when sending discovery messages.

  • DiscoveryClient(String)

    Creates a new instance of the DiscoveryClient class with the specified endpoint configuration.

    public DiscoveryClient (string endpointConfigurationName);

    Parameters

    • endpointConfigurationName
      String

      The endpoint configuration name to use.

Properties

  • ChannelFactory

    Gets the channel factory for the DiscoveryClient.

    public System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory ChannelFactory { get; }

    Property Value

    • ChannelFactory

      A channel factory.

  • ClientCredentials

    Gets the client credentials for the DiscoveryClient.

    public System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials ClientCredentials { get; }

    Property Value

    • ClientCredentials

      The client credentials for the DiscoveryClient.

  • Endpoint

    Gets the endpoint used to send discovery messages.

    public System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint Endpoint { get; }

    Property Value

    • ServiceEndpoint

      The endpoint used to send discovery messages.

  • InnerChannel

    Gets the channel used to send discovery messages.

    public System.ServiceModel.IClientChannel InnerChannel { get; }

    Property Value

    • IClientChannel

      The channel used to send discovery messages.

Methods

  • CancelAsync(Object)

    Cancels a pending asynchronous operation.

    public void CancelAsync (object userState);

    Parameters

    • userState
      System.Object

      A user specified state object that is passed to the stem.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryClient.FindAsync* method or one of the stem.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryClient.ResolveAsync* methods. It identifies the pending asynchronous operation to cancel.

    Remarks

    An ArgumentNullException is thrown if userState is null. If multiple FindAsync or ResolveAsync operations are called with the same userState value, and CancelAsync is called with that userState value, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.

  • Close()

    Closes the discovery client.

    public void Close ();
  • Find(FindCriteria)

    Sends a request to find services that match the specified criteria.

    public System.ServiceModel.Discovery.FindResponse Find (System.ServiceModel.Discovery.FindCriteria criteria);

    Parameters

    • criteria
      FindCriteria

      The criteria for finding services.

    Returns

    • FindResponse

      The discoverable metadata of the matching service endpoints.

  • FindAsync(FindCriteria)

    Begins an asynchronous find operation with the specified criteria.

    public void FindAsync (System.ServiceModel.Discovery.FindCriteria criteria);

    Parameters

    • criteria
      FindCriteria

      The criteria for finding services.

    Remarks

    Find operations initiated by calling this method cannot be canceled.

  • FindAsync(FindCriteria,Object)

    Begins an asynchronous find operation with the specified criteria and user defined state object.

    public void FindAsync (System.ServiceModel.Discovery.FindCriteria criteria, object userState);

    Parameters

    • criteria
      FindCriteria

      The criteria for finding services.

    • userState
      System.Object

      A user specified object to identify the asynchronous find operation.

    Remarks

    If the userState parameter is null, the find operation cannot be canceled.

  • FindTaskAsync(FindCriteria)

    Begins an asynchronous find task operation with the specified criteria.

    public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<System.ServiceModel.Discovery.FindResponse> FindTaskAsync (System.ServiceModel.Discovery.FindCriteria criteria);

    Parameters

    • criteria
      FindCriteria

      The criteria for finding services.

    Returns

    • Task<FindResponse>

      An asynchronous find task operation.

  • FindTaskAsync(FindCriteria,CancellationToken)

    Begins an asynchronous find task operation with the specified criteria and cancellation token object.

    public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<System.ServiceModel.Discovery.FindResponse> FindTaskAsync (System.ServiceModel.Discovery.FindCriteria criteria, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);

    Parameters

    • criteria
      FindCriteria

      The criteria for finding services.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The cancellation token for notification propagation.

    Returns

    • Task<FindResponse>

      An asynchronous find task operation.

  • Open()

    Opens the DiscoveryClient.

    public void Open ();

    Remarks

    This method transitions the discovery client to the open state.

  • Resolve(ResolveCriteria)

    Begins an asynchronous resolve operation with the specified criteria.

    public System.ServiceModel.Discovery.ResolveResponse Resolve (System.ServiceModel.Discovery.ResolveCriteria criteria);

    Parameters

    • criteria
      ResolveCriteria

      The criteria for matching a service endpoint.

    Returns

    • ResolveResponse

      The discoverable metadata of the service endpoint at the specified address, or null if no service endpoint is found at the specified address.

  • ResolveAsync(ResolveCriteria)

    Begins an asynchronous resolve operation with the specified criteria.

    public void ResolveAsync (System.ServiceModel.Discovery.ResolveCriteria criteria);

    Parameters

    • criteria
      ResolveCriteria

      The criteria for matching a service endpoint.

    Remarks

    Resolve operations initiated by calling this method cannot be canceled.

  • ResolveAsync(ResolveCriteria,Object)

    Begins an asynchronous resolve operation with the specified criteria and user-defined state object.

    public void ResolveAsync (System.ServiceModel.Discovery.ResolveCriteria criteria, object userState);

    Parameters

    • criteria
      ResolveCriteria

      The criteria for matching a service endpoint.

    • userState
      System.Object

      A user specified object to identify the asynchronous resolve operation.

    Remarks

    If the userState parameter is null, the resolve operation cannot be canceled.

  • ResolveTaskAsync(ResolveCriteria)

    Begins an asynchronous resolve task operation with the specified criteria.

    public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<System.ServiceModel.Discovery.ResolveResponse> ResolveTaskAsync (System.ServiceModel.Discovery.ResolveCriteria criteria);

    Parameters

    • criteria
      ResolveCriteria

      The criteria for matching a service endpoint.

    Returns

    • Task<ResolveResponse>

      An asynchronouos resolve task operation.

  • ResolveTaskAsync(ResolveCriteria,CancellationToken)

    Begins an asynchronous resolve task operation with the specified criteria and cancellation token.

    public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<System.ServiceModel.Discovery.ResolveResponse> ResolveTaskAsync (System.ServiceModel.Discovery.ResolveCriteria criteria, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);

    Parameters

    • criteria
      ResolveCriteria

      The criteria for matching a service endpoint.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The cancellation token for notification propagation.

    Returns

    • Task<ResolveResponse>

      An asynchronous resolve task operation.

Events

  • FindCompleted

    Occurs when the entire find operation completes.

    public event EventHandler<System.ServiceModel.Discovery.FindCompletedEventArgs> FindCompleted;

    Remarks

    The Result property contains information about all matching services. For more information about this event see Asynchronous Find.

  • FindProgressChanged

    Occurs every time the client receives a response from a particular service.

    public event EventHandler<System.ServiceModel.Discovery.FindProgressChangedEventArgs> FindProgressChanged;

    Remarks

    This event is useful if you are processing the results as they arrive. For more information about this event see Asynchronous Find.

  • ProxyAvailable

    Occurs when a multicast suppression message is received from a discovery proxy in response to the find or resolve operation.

    public event EventHandler<System.ServiceModel.Discovery.AnnouncementEventArgs> ProxyAvailable;
  • ResolveCompleted

    Occurs when an asynchronous resolve operation is completed.

    public event EventHandler<System.ServiceModel.Discovery.ResolveCompletedEventArgs> ResolveCompleted;

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IDisposable.Dispose()

    Provides an implementation of the stem.IDisposable.Dispose* method.

    void IDisposable.Dispose ();
  • ICommunicationObject.Abort()

    Causes a communication object to transition immediately from its current state into the closed state.

    void ICommunicationObject.Abort ();
  • ICommunicationObject.BeginClose(AsyncCallback,Object)

    Begins an asynchronous operation to close a communication object.

    IAsyncResult ICommunicationObject.BeginClose (AsyncCallback callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • callback
      AsyncCallback

      The AsyncCallback delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous close operation.

    • state
      System.Object

      An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous close operation.

    Returns

    • IAsyncResult

      The IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous close operation.

  • ICommunicationObject.BeginClose(TimeSpan,AsyncCallback,Object)

    Begins an asynchronous operation to close a communication object with a specified timeout.

    IAsyncResult ICommunicationObject.BeginClose (TimeSpan timeout, AsyncCallback callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • timeout
      TimeSpan

      The TimeSpan that specifies how long the send operation has to complete before timing out.

    • callback
      AsyncCallback

      The AsyncCallback delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous close operation.

    • state
      System.Object

      An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous close operation.

    Returns

    • IAsyncResult

      The IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous close operation.

  • ICommunicationObject.BeginOpen(AsyncCallback,Object)

    Begins an asynchronous operation to open a communication object.

    IAsyncResult ICommunicationObject.BeginOpen (AsyncCallback callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • callback
      AsyncCallback

      The AsyncCallback delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous open operation.

    • state
      System.Object

      An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous open operation.

    Returns

    • IAsyncResult

      The IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous open operation.

  • ICommunicationObject.BeginOpen(TimeSpan,AsyncCallback,Object)

    Begins an asynchronous operation to open a communication object within a specified interval of time.

    IAsyncResult ICommunicationObject.BeginOpen (TimeSpan timeout, AsyncCallback callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • timeout
      TimeSpan

      The TimeSpan that specifies how long the send operation has to complete before timing out.

    • callback
      AsyncCallback

      The AsyncCallback delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous open operation.

    • state
      System.Object

      An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous open operation.

    Returns

    • IAsyncResult

      The IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous open operation.

  • ICommunicationObject.Close()

    Causes a communication object to transition from its current state into the closed state.

    void ICommunicationObject.Close ();
  • ICommunicationObject.Close(TimeSpan)

    Causes a communication object to transition from its current state into the closed state within a specified interval of time.

    void ICommunicationObject.Close (TimeSpan timeout);

    Parameters

    • timeout
      TimeSpan

      The TimeSpan that specifies how long the send operation has to complete before timing out.

  • ICommunicationObject.EndClose(IAsyncResult)

    Completes an asynchronous operation to close a communication object.

    void ICommunicationObject.EndClose (IAsyncResult result);

    Parameters

    • result
      IAsyncResult

      The IAsyncResult that is returned by a call to the ICommunicationObject.EndClose method.

  • ICommunicationObject.EndOpen(IAsyncResult)

    Completes an asynchronous operation to open a communication object.

    void ICommunicationObject.EndOpen (IAsyncResult result);

    Parameters

    • result
      IAsyncResult

      The IAsyncResult that is returned by a call to the stem.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.BeginOpen* method.

  • ICommunicationObject.Open()

    Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state.

    void ICommunicationObject.Open ();
  • ICommunicationObject.Open(TimeSpan)

    Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state within a specified interval of time.

    void ICommunicationObject.Open (TimeSpan timeout);

    Parameters

    • timeout
      TimeSpan

      The TimeSpan that specifies how long the send operation has to complete before timing out.

  • ICommunicationObject.State

    Gets the current state of the communication-oriented object.

    System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.State { get; }

    Returns

    • CommunicationState

      The value of the CommunicationState of the object.
